benchmark_details.name: TAXI (Taxonomic Inference)
benchmark_details.overview: TAXI is a new benchmark dataset specifically created to evaluate consistency in categorical knowledge edits in language models. It contains 11,120 multiple-choice queries for 976 edits spanning 41 categories, 164 subjects, and 183 properties.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate knowledge editors' ability to consistently and coherently edit large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The categories, subjects, and properties included in TAXI were manually selected and may not be fully representative of broader natural language categories.

data.source: Manually created dataset of categorical edits.

methods: Knowledge Editing with model editing techniques
methodology.calculation: Accuracy scores computed over a set of query prompts with expected continuations associated with the newly-assigned category.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better consistency and accuracy in categorical knowledge editing.
methodology.baseline_results: Human subjects achieve approximately 86.8% accuracy on the same tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The human study included diverse participants but did not focus on demographic analysis.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: The human study was conducted under the approval of the Institutional Review Board at Arizona State University.
